author: talkSPORT
title: Ranked! Every current top flight club's longest winning run in the Premier League
description: Arsenal will be getting nervous over rivals Chelsea breaking their winning streak record this season. The Blues made it 10 wins on the bounce last night, beating Sunderland 1-0 to go six points clear at the top of the table. But how does Chelsea's current run compare to their Premier League rivals? We've decided to take a look at the longest winning streak every current top flight club has recorded – find out where your side ranks by scrolling through the gallery above.

title: Va. Tech also received Wake Forest insider intel
description: A former Virginia Tech assistant coach received "game plan information" from Wake Forest radio broadcaster Tommy Elrod before a 2014 game, the Hokies acknowledged Thursday.

author: talkSPORT
title: LISTEN: Ross Barkley would struggle to get into Tottenham's first team - Harry Redknapp reacts to transfer rumour
description: Harry Redknapp has raised concerns over Tottenham’s reported interest in Ross Barkley, saying the Everton man would struggle for regular game time at White Hart Lane. Recent reports have claimed Spurs are keen to lure the England international away from his hometown club, as they search for greater attacking support for top striker Harry Kane.

title: Gemma Gibbons & Ashley McKenzie: Olympic judo pair have funding removed

title: Smith century puts Australia ahead on first day
description: Steven Smith and Peter Handscomb capitalized on the platform laid by Matt Renshaw with an unbroken 137-run stand to take Australia to 288 for 3 at stumps

author: talkSPORT
title: 'All in all an unsatisfactory midweek of football' - Arsenal fans react to 'disaster' as Chelsea, Manchester United, Manchester City, Tottenham and Liverpool all win
description: Arsenal endured a horrid midweek of Premier League football, seeing all their title rivals win the day after they were on the end of a 2-1 defeat at Everton. Ashley Williams' header secured all three points for the Toffees, and meant Liverpool could move level on points with the Gunners - which they did with a win over Middlesbrough - and could also see Chelsea move six points clear at the top of the table - which they did by beating Sunderland 1-0.

author: talkSPORT
title: 'All in all an unsatisfactory midweek of football' - Arsenal fans react to 'disaster' as Chelsea, Manchester United, Manchester City, Tottenham and Liverpool all win
description: Arsenal endured a horrid midweek of Premier League football, seeing all their title rivals win the day after they were on the end of a 2-1 defeat at Everton. Ashley Williams' header secured all three points for the Toffees, and meant Liverpool could move level on points with the Gunners - which they did with a win over Middlesbrough - and could also see Chelsea move six points clear at the top of the table - which they did by beating Sunderland 1-0.

author: talkSPORT
title: Ilkay Gundogan: Manchester City midfielder set for long absence due to suspected knee ligament injury
description: Manchester City midfielder Ilkay Gundogan is set to miss several months of action after suffering a bad knee injury during Wednesday's 2-0 win over Watford. The German midfielder jarred his right knee in the first half at the Etihad Stadium and after unsuccessfully trying to play on, came off in clear distress just before the break. Gundogan dislocated his right knee cap last spring and spent several months in recovery prior to joining City, whose boss Guardiola expects more bad news for the player.

title: Source: Patriots claim WR Floyd after DUI arrest
description: The Patriots have claimed wide receiver Michael Floyd, who was waived by the Cardinals following his DUI arrest earlier this week, a source told ESPN's Field Yates.

title: Malky Mackay wants to be judged by actions in SFA performance director role

author: talkSPORT
title: Highest paid footballers in the world 2016 with Oscar set to earn more than Neymar and Messi
description: Chelsea midfielder Oscar is closing in on a shock transfer to Chinese club Shanghai SIPG for a reported £60 million fee. The playmaker will become the latest star name to head to the lucrative Chinese Super League, following fellow Brazilians Hulk and Ramires, and former Premier League stars Graziano Pelle and Asamoah Gyan.

title: Exclusive - Kell Brook vows to end Amir Khan's career as British super-fight edges closer
description: Kell Brook has vowed to end British rival Amir Khan’s career. Promoter Eddie Hearn has begun talks over an eagerly-awaited domestic dust-up in 2017 between current IBF welterweight champion Brook and the former light-welterweight world champion. Brook, who lost his unbeaten record to middleweight king Gennady Golovkin in September, is ready and waiting to sign on the dotted line.

author: talkSPORT
title: Luis Suarez agrees new Barcelona deal to June 2021
description: Luis Suarez has agreed a new deal that will see him remain with Barcelona until June 30, 2021, with a huge buyout clause of 200 million euros inserted. The former Liverpool striker has been prolific since swapping Anfield for the Nou Camp in a deal reported to be worth £75million two and a half years ago, scoring 97 times in 116 matches in all competitions. The Uruguayan is also part of the much-feared MSN forward line at Barca as he, Lionel Messi and Neymar have been terrorising defences at home and abroad.

author: By Michael Kelleher
title: Tony Bellew aims to unify cruiserweight division after David Haye fight
description: Tony Bellew admits he dreams of fighting for a heavyweight title but says he intends to return to cruiserweight first to unify the division, after fighting David Haye.

title: Why Jose Mourinho was banned by Football Association
description: Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho received a one-match touchline ban after he

author: TheSPORTbible
title: Jack Wilshere Doesn't Think Ozil Or Sanchez Are Arsenal's Best Player
description: Another player gets the midfielder's seal of approval, instead

author: talkSPORT
title: Luis Suarez agrees new Barcelona deal to June 2021
description: Luis Suarez has agreed a new deal that will see him remain with Barcelona until June 30, 2021, with a huge buyout clause of 200 million euros inserted. The former Liverpool striker has been prolific since swapping Anfield for the Nou Camp in a deal reported to be worth £75million two and a half years ago, scoring 97 times in 116 matches in all competitions. The Uruguayan is also part of the much-feared MSN forward line at Barca as he, Lionel Messi and Neymar have been terrorising defences at home and abroad.

author: talkSPORT
title: LISTEN: Ross Barkley would struggle to get into Tottenham's first team - Harry Redknapp reacts to transfer rumour
description: Harry Redknapp has raised concerns over Tottenham’s reported interest in Ross Barkley, saying the Everton man would struggle for regular game time at White Hart Lane. Recent reports have claimed Spurs are keen to lure the England international away from his hometown club, as they search for greater attacking support for top striker Harry Kane.

author: BBC Sport
title: India v England: Spinner Liam Dawson set for Test debut
description: Spinner Liam Dawson is set to make his Test debut for England in the fifth and final match against India in Chennai.

title: Source: Hamilton cleared, to work out for Texas
description: Josh Hamilton, hoping for a minor league deal with the Rangers, has been cleared for baseball activities after having knee surgery in June.

author: talkSPORT
title: 'All in all an unsatisfactory midweek of football' - Arsenal fans react to 'disaster' as Chelsea, Manchester United, Manchester City, Tottenham and Liverpool all win
description: Arsenal endured a horrid midweek of Premier League football, seeing all their title rivals win the day after they were on the end of a 2-1 defeat at Everton. Ashley Williams' header secured all three points for the Toffees, and meant Liverpool could move level on points with the Gunners - which they did with a win over Middlesbrough - and could also see Chelsea move six points clear at the top of the table - which they did by beating Sunderland 1-0.

author: talkSPORT
title: Highest paid footballers in the world 2016 with Oscar set to earn more than Neymar and Messi
description: Chelsea midfielder Oscar is closing in on a shock transfer to Chinese club Shanghai SIPG for a reported £60 million fee. The playmaker will become the latest star name to head to the lucrative Chinese Super League, following fellow Brazilians Hulk and Ramires, and former Premier League stars Graziano Pelle and Asamoah Gyan.

author: Sidharth Monga in Chennai
title: Kohli 'would love' a county stint before 2018 England tour
description: The India captain wanted at least a month's time to get used to conditions, but only a short stint might be possible with current schedules

author: BBC Sport
title: Gemma Gibbons & Ashley McKenzie: Olympic judo pair have funding removed
description: Commonwealth champion Ashley McKenzie and 2012 Olympic silver medallist Gemma Gibbons have their funding removed by British Judo.

author: Alex Varney
title: Exclusive - Kell Brook vows to end Amir Khan's career as British super-fight edges closer
description: Kell Brook has vowed to end British rival Amir Khan’s career. Promoter Eddie Hearn has begun talks over an eagerly-awaited domestic dust-up in 2017 between current IBF welterweight champion Brook and the former light-welterweight world champion. Brook, who lost his unbeaten record to middleweight king Gennady Golovkin in September, is ready and waiting to sign on the dotted line.

title: Jets' Marshall continues rant, flags Fins' Maxwell
description: Brandon Marshall, picking up his rant from six weeks ago, again flagged Dolphins CB Byron Maxwell for excessive holding.

author: BBC Sport
title: Gemma Gibbons & Ashley McKenzie: Olympic judo pair have funding removed
description: Commonwealth champion Ashley McKenzie and 2012 Olympic silver medallist Gemma Gibbons have their funding removed by British Judo.

author: BBC Sport
title: Anthony Joshua v Wladimir Klitschko: A classic clash of generations
description: It's 'big bro' v 'little bro' - and after all the pantomime surrounding recent heavyweight bouts, Ben Dirs is looking forward to some plain old boxing.

author: talkSPORT
title: Ilkay Gundogan: Manchester City midfielder set for long absence due to suspected knee ligament injury
description: Manchester City midfielder Ilkay Gundogan is set to miss several months of action after suffering a bad knee injury during Wednesday's 2-0 win over Watford. The German midfielder jarred his right knee in the first half at the Etihad Stadium and after unsuccessfully trying to play on, came off in clear distress just before the break. Gundogan dislocated his right knee cap last spring and spent several months in recovery prior to joining City, whose boss Guardiola expects more bad news for the player.

title: Ranked! Every current top flight club's longest winning run in the Premier League

The Blues made it 10 wins on the bounce last night, beating Sunderland 1-0 to go six points clear at the top of the table. But how does Chelsea's current run compare to their Premier League rivals? We've decided to take a look at the longest winning streak every current top flight club has recorded – find out where your side ranks by scrolling through the gallery above.
